ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic leg
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic leg. While it lacks a neural interface, its complex arrangement of internal joints allows it to mimic natural movement quite convincingly. Still, it is inferior to a real leg.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic arm
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic arm. While it lacks a neural interface, its complex arrangement of internal joints allows it to mimic natural movement quite convincingly. Still, it is inferior to a real arm.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic tail
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic tail, crafted to replace a lost or injured tail, providing support, balance, and expression while facilitating natural movement and comfort.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic jaw
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic jaw, tailored to restore oral function and aesthetics, enabling animals to eat, drink, and interact comfortably.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic heart
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic heart. It contains an electric motor that pumps blood smoothly around the body.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic spine
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic spine consisting of basic materials and rudimentary construction, offering modest support and mobility enhancement. Worse than an undamaged natural spine.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic stomach
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic stomach constructed from rudimentary materials, providing minimal digestive support. It lacks advanced features and offers a simple solution for basic nutrient processing, although it is worse than an undamaged natural stomach.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic lung
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic lung made with simple components, offering basic respiratory support. Despite its simplicity, it aids in oxygenation to a limited extent, supporting the animal's breathing function. Worse than an undamaged natural lung.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic kidney
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic kidney providing elementary filtration capabilities. Though lacking complexity, it offers a simple solution for waste removal, aiding in maintaining basic metabolic balance. Worse than an undamaged natural kidney.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic liver
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic liver offering rudimentary detoxification functions. Despite its simplicity, it provides a straightforward solution for metabolic regulation. Worse than an undamaged natural liver.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic beak
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic beak built with simple materials. Should be able to replace almost any avian-like beak.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic tentacle
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic tentacle built with simple materials. Should be able to replace almost any tentacle, though they'll be quite rigid and not very functional, specially if the animal uses it for locomotion. Bear in mind the original animal needs to have tentacles of its own. For extra tentacles, look into Anomaly implants.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic buoyancy mechanism
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic buoyancy mechanism built with simple materials. Should be able to replace hydrogen sacs and other exotic organs keeping hovering creatures in the air.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic shell
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic shell constructed from basic, durable materials, providing essential protection and structural support. Though simple in design, it offers a practical solution for shielding the animal from harm.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic wing
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic wing made from basic, sturdy materials, offering essential support for limited flight and gliding. Though simple, it provides a functional solution for basic aerial mobility. Note that base game birds DON'T have wings (yes, really).

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic blade
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic blade made from basic, sturdy materials. Will replace a range of biological structures such as single claws (not claws that are part of a paw, for example) and an insect's headclaw.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic stinger
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic stinger made from basic, sturdy materials and designed to replace a lost or damaged stinger.

ThingDef.label: animal prosthetic horn
ThingDef.description: An animal prosthetic horn acting as a synthetic replacement for a lost or damaged horn, crafted from durable materials to restore natural appearance and function.

ThingDef.label: animal power claw
ThingDef.description: A combat-oriented paw replacement consisting of a hooked claw extending besides the animal's original limb. It cuts deep, and it is strong enough to crush a skull like a hand crushes an egg. Its overall ungainliness slows down movement slightly.

ThingDef.label: animal painstopper
ThingDef.description: An animal brain implant which inhibits nociception, or pain sensation. While it does allow the user to accomplish more, it turns out pain has a purpose. When you don't feel it, you can get hurt really bad really easily.

ThingDef.label: animal controller
ThingDef.description: An animal mind controller implant. This implant will allow this creature to be drafted and controlled by the player. Counts as a prosthetic when considering animal body size to be installed.

ThingDef.label: animal pouncing leg
ThingDef.description: An animal pouncing leg. Engineered with high-tension springs and advanced composite materials, it enables the animal to make precise, powerful leaps.

ThingDef.label: animal thermoregulator
ThingDef.description: An animal thermoregulator implant using sensors and adaptive materials to maintain optimal body temperature in varying environmental conditions, enhancing the animal's ability to thrive in extreme heat or cold.
